title: Product Opportunity
description:
1. Understanding your company and product needs: The first stage allows us to understand the needs of your company and the product you are keen to test, and for you to understand the mission and capabilities of the Living Lab team.
  2. Open communication: Secondly, signing a non-disclosure agreement so that you can communicate details with us in confidence.
  3. Understanding your product: Thirdly, for us to understand in detail what your product does, its functional specifications and the environment in which it will be deployed.
  4. Forming a collaboration team: We will form a joint team to work on developing the test procedures. This is done in a collaborative, online environment enabling ease of communication between team members. Once drafted the test procedures are approved and executed, results are rapidly shared with the team members and a final report is co-drafted by the team.

requirements.title: Test Checklist
requirements.content:
It is essential that the functional requirements and operating conditions are known prior to designing an accelerated life test. A Failure Modes and Effects Analysis may be required prior to, or in conjunction with the Accelerated Life Testing development.
  • Product functional specification documentation
  • General technical specification required by your future potential customers
  • Failure Modes and Effects Analysis (FMEA) (or similar product risk assessment process)
  • Instructions for installation, troubleshooting, resetting and removal
  • Contact instructions and processes

title: Function and Safety Standards
description: Your functional requirements and anticipated operating conditions will determine the nature of the accelerated life tests to be conducted. Where you have Standards you need to meet, we will ask you to share these with us, and we can also access Australian and International Standards. There are several standards for testing such as vibration, UV and ingress protection standards that are referenced by companies throughout Australia. For ease of access we have made some of these available here.

requirements.title: Examples of ALT Standards
requirements.content:
• Occupational Safety and Health Act 1984 (WA) and Occupational Safety and Health Regulations 1996 (WA)
  • AS60529 Degrees of Protection provided by enclosures (IP Code)
  • ISO 4892-1 Plastics - Methods of exposure to laboratory light sources - Part 1: General guidance
  • ISO 4892-2 Plastics - Methods of exposure to laboratory light sources - Part 2: Xenon-arc lamps
  • MIL-STD-810H Environmental considerations and laboratory tests
  • I.S. EN IEC 61000-6-2:2019 Electromagnetic Compatibility (EMC) - Part 6-2: Generic Standards - Immunity Standard for Industrial Environments
  • I.S. EN IEC 61000-6-4:2019 Electromagnetic Compatibility (EMC) - Part 6-4: Generic Standards - Emission Standard for Industrial Environments
  • ISO 16750:2018 Road vehicles
  • AS 60068.2.78-2003 Environmental testing Part 2.78: Tests-Test Cab: Damp heat, steady state
  • AS 60068.2.2-2003 Environmental Testing Part 2.2: Tests-Tests B: Dry heat
  • AS 60068.2.1-2003 Environmental Testing Part 2.1: Tests-Tests A: Cold

title: Accelerated Life Tests
description: Some of the processes we have developed thus far is shown here or below.

title: Accelerated Life Test Trial Proposal
description: This proposal is co-developed by the team and your company, and broadly covers:

requirements.title: Structure
requirements.content:
1. Overview of the intent of the trials
  2. Section for each type of trial (UV, IP, etc)
    • Function being tested
    • Non-accelerated time period and operating conditions
    • Test options
      • Equipment
      • Test conditions and time, supporting calculations
      • Relevant Standards
      • Costs (for consumables)
    • Comparison of test options
    • Detailed test description
      • Aims/ hypothesis
      • Test method
      • Equipment required
      • Procedure
      • Results
    • Risk and safety assessment
